pl.edu.agh.icsr.janet.util
Class DataEncapsulator

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--pl.edu.agh.icsr.janet.util.DataEncapsulator
public abstract class DataEncapsulator
extends java.lang.Object

Wrapper for a native variable (usually a pointer). Conceptually, object of this class may represent a native data structure referenced by a given pointer. The pointer is stored as a protected long data field. In subclasses you may define additional accessor methods in order to provide a Java interface to the encapsulated native data structure.

Field Summary

          Value of a native variable.

  DataEncapsulator()
          Creates new DataEncapsulator object with empty data field (as obtained from the #getNullValue() method).
protected DataEncapsulator(long data)
          Creates new DataEncapsulator object with given data.
 
Method Summary
protected  void finalize()
          If the data value is not empty, invokes #free() during object finalization to perform native-side clean-up.
 void free()
          Disposes attached native data structure (by invoking #freeNative() method) and clears the data variable.
protected  void freeNative()
          This method is invoked when the encapsulated data variable is being changed or cleared, so that the native data structure should be disposed.
protected  long getNullValue()
          Returns the value representing empty reference (default 0).
 boolean isNull()
          Checks if the data field is empty (equals to the value returned by the #getNullValue() method).

isNull

public final boolean isNull()
Checks if the data field is empty (equals to the value returned by the #getNullValue() method).

freeNative

protected void freeNative()
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
This method is invoked when the encapsulated data variable is being changed or cleared, so that the native data structure should be disposed. You should usually override this method to perform any neccessary clean-up.

java.lang.Throwable

free

public void free()
          throws java.lang.Throwable
Disposes attached native data structure (by invoking #freeNative() method) and clears the data variable. This method should be used to dispose native data before the reference is dropped, in preference to relying on object finalization. #throws NullPointerException if the data variable is already empty, i.e. equals to the value returned by #getNullValue().

java.lang.Throwable

finalize

protected final void finalize()
                       throws java.lang.Throwable
If the data value is not empty, invokes #free() during object finalization to perform native-side clean-up.

Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object
java.lang.Throwable
